intro: Spiraea japonica f. atrosanguinea, commonly known as the dark red weeping spirea, is a compact, shrub-like plant native to Japan. It features slender, arching branches that bear clusters of small, dark red flowers in early summer. The foliage is typically dark green, providing a striking contrast to the vibrant floral display. This variety is prized for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. It prefers partial shade to full sun and well-drained soil, making it adaptable to a variety of growing conditions.
